CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 11, 1954, pg. 1, reads: "School Starts - This a typical scene in which occurred at most homes in Pittsburgh district on Tuesday this week. Summer, with its days of care-free pleasure, was over for the children, and mother, who had the endless job of caring for their wants and whims hour by hour, now only had to worry about the gigantic task of getting her brood off to school in the morning and seeing that night work, tasks and play were done in the after-school hours.  Mrs. Helena Beasley of 7608 Mulford Street is shown as she sent her three youngsters - Sandra, Katharine and Charlene - off to school for the new term. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Helena Beasley fixing hair of her daughter Charlene with daughters Katharine in middle, and Sandra on left, on first day of school, in front of their home at 7608 Mulford Street, Homewood
